intro: Roucheria angulata, commonly known as the angular roucheria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has a compact growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
